meanings.definition: The plural form of 'front', meaning the side or part of an object that faces forward.
meanings.sent1: The frontes of the car were damaged in the accident.
meanings.sent2: She stood at the frontes of the line to buy tickets.
meanings.sent3: The frontes of the cake were decorated with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: The frontes of the building welcomed visitors with grand architecture.
meanings.sent5: The frontes of the bookshelves displayed a collection of antique books.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'front', meaning the foremost part or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The frontes of the ship were painted in bright colors.
meanings.sent2: He placed the vase on the frontes of the table.
meanings.sent3: The frontes of the cookies were covered in chocolate chips.
meanings.sent4: The frontes of the mountains glowed in the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The frontes of the house had a welcoming porch.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'front', meaning the area or position directly ahead of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The frontes of the classroom were filled with eager students.
meanings.sent2: She scanned the frontes of the crowd to find her friend.
meanings.sent3: The frontes of the park were bustling with activity.
meanings.sent4: The frontes of the stage were illuminated by bright lights.
meanings.sent5: The frontes of the line moved quickly at the amusement park.
